intro: Baccharis camporum var. integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth baccharis, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually smooth or slightly hairy on the upper surface. Its small, clustered flowers appear in the fall, producing a pale yellow to white coloration. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
